jparsec.astrophysics.gildas

Class LMVCube

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.astrophysics.gildas.LMVCube
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class LMVCube
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class to read/write lmv (GILDAS) datacubes. A datacube can be created in two ways: from a GILDAS .lmv (or .gdf) file or directly by inserting the cube and the rest of the data in the constructor. In the first case the property cube will continue to be equal to null to prevent memory errors when reading large files. Whenever you retrieve the cube of data the input file will be read again. You should prevent this behavior using setCubeData(float[][][]), or using the method that reduces the resolution of the cube. In the second case the cube must be explicitly inserted in the constructor or the cube property. It is supposed that enough memory is available to hold the instance in this case. In large files (>20 MB) to previously smooth the datacube to a lower resolution level could be required.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public int[] minimumAndMaximumFluxPositions
        Minimum and maximum position for axis 1, 2, 3, and 4. Units are pixels on the image, starting from 1 (Gildas or Fortran convention).

      • numberOfAxes

        public int axis3Dim
        Dimension in axis 3.

      • axis4Dim

        public int axis4Dim
        Dimension in axis 4.

      • conversionFormula

        public double[] conversionFormula
        Conversion formula. It is formed by 4 sets of 3 values containing respectively a reference pixel, value, and increment for axis 1, 2, 3, and 4. Note that these values follows GILDAS conventions, where y axis goes up following declination, so reference pixel and increment is inverted in y axis respect to common Java conventions where the pixel (0, 0) is the top-left corner of the image. In addition, first pixel in the cube data is pixel reference (1, 1, 1).

      • blanking

        public float blanking
        Blanking value in map units.

      • blankingTolerance

        Tolerance of blanking value.

        public LMVCube(java.lang.String source,
       float[][][] cube,
       java.lang.String unit,
       java.lang.String line,

       double skyPA,
       float blanking,
       float blankTol,
       double[] formula,
       float rms,
       float dra,
       float ddec,
       float parallax)
        throws JPARSECException
        Full constructor for a cube with 3 axes ordered as [velocity][dec][ra], and projection type AZP.
        Parameters:
        source - Source name.
        cube - The cube.
        unit - The map units.
        line - The line name.
        freq - The frequency in MHz.
        label1 - Label for x axis.
        label2 - Label for y axis.
        label3 - Label for z axis.
        raPos - The right ascension of the reference pixel in radians.
        decPos - Declination of the reference pixel in radians.
        ra - The right ascension of the source in radians.
        dec - Declination of the source in radians.
        v0 - Velocity offset in km/s.
        coordSys - Coordinate system.
        epoch - Epoch of coordinates.
        beamMajor - Beam major axis in radians.
        beamMinor - Beam minor axis in radians.
        beamPA - Beam position angle in radians.
        skyPA - Position angle in the sky.
        blanking - Blanking value.
        blankTol - Tolerance of blanking.
        formula - Conversion formula.
        rms - The rms.
        dra - Proper motion in RA.
        ddec - Proper motion in DEC.
        parallax - Parallax.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

        throws JPARSECException
        Almost full constructor for a cube with 3 axes ordered as [velocity][dec][ra], and projection type AZP. The position for the reference pixel is taken from the source position.
        Parameters:
        source - Source name.
        cube - The cube.
        unit - The map units.
        line - The line name.
        freq - The frequency in MHz.
        label1 - Label for x axis.
        label2 - Label for y axis.
        label3 - Label for z axis.
        ra - The right ascension in radians.
        dec - Declination in radians.
        v0 - Velocity offset in km/s.

        beamMinor - Beam minor axis in radians.
        beamPA - Beam position angle in radians.
        skyPA - Position angle in the sky.
        blanking - Blanking value.
        blankTol - Tolerance of blanking.
        formula - Conversion formula.
        rms - The rms.
        dra - Proper motion in RA.
        ddec - Proper motion in DEC.
        parallax - Parallax.

    • Method Detail

      • getCubeData

        public float[][][] getCubeData()
                        throws JPARSECException
        Returns the data in the cube changing any blanking values to zero. This change is required to use the returned data as input for a given 2D/3D chart. This method reads again the header if the cube data is empty to set the internal variables to their original values, without any smooth.
        Returns:
        The cube of data as an array in 3d, ordered by number of levels, number of columns (DEC), and number of rows (RA).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs, for example if the file is not an lmv one.

      • getCubeData

        public float[][][] getCubeData(boolean applyBlanking)
                        throws JPARSECException
        Returns the data in the cube changing optionally any blanking values to zero. This change is required to use the returned data as input for a given 2D/3D chart. This method reads again the header if the cube data is empty to set the internal variables to their original values, without any smooth.
        Parameters:
        applyBlanking - True to apply blanking (setting to 0 values equal to it). This is slow when requesting frequently the cube data.
        Returns:
        The cube of data as an array in 3d, ordered by number of levels, number of columns (DEC), and number of rows (RA).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs, for example if the file is not an lmv one.

      • getAsTable

        public Table getAsTable(int plane,
               boolean rawData)
                 throws JPARSECException
        Returns the cube as a Table object.
        Parameters:
        plane - The plane to return, or -1 for integrated intensity.
        rawData - True to return raw data with the blanking value set to a given value, or false to return 0 as blanking.
        Returns:
        The cube.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getRawCubeData

        public float[][][] getRawCubeData()
                           throws JPARSECException
        Returns the raw data in the cube without any modification. This method reads again the header if the cube data is empty to set the internal variables to their original values, without any smooth.
        Returns:
        The raw data of the cube as an array in 3d, ordered by number of levels, number of columns (DEC), and number of rows (RA).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs, for example if the file is not an lmv one.

        public void write(java.lang.String path)
           throws JPARSECException
        Writes the instance to a .lmv file.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the file.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getRawCubeData

        public float[][] getRawCubeData(int plane)
                         throws JPARSECException
        Returns the data in the cube for a given velocity plane. This method reads again the header if the cube data is empty to set the internal variables to their original values, without any smooth.
        Parameters:
        plane - The index of the velocity plane in the file, starting from 0.
        Returns:
        The plane, ordered as axis1, axis2 (oposite as getCubeData()).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the plane is invalid.

      • getCubeData

        public float[][] getCubeData(int plane)
                      throws JPARSECException
        Returns the data in the cube for a given velocity plane. Possible blanking values are changed to zero. This method reads again the header if the cube data is empty to set the internal variables to their original values, without any smooth.
        Parameters:
        plane - The index of the velocity plane in the file, starting from 0.
        Returns:
        The plane, ordered as axis1, axis2 (oposite as getCubeData()).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the plane is invalid.

      • getRawCubeData

        public float[][] getRawCubeData(int plane,
                       int max1,
                       int max2,
                       int max3)
                         throws JPARSECException
        Returns the data in a given plane of the cube smoothing it if necessary. The internal variables are modified to properly account for the new size of the cube data.
        Parameters:
        plane - The index of the velocity plane in the file, starting from 0.
        max1 - Maximum number of elements in x axis.
        max2 - Maximum number of elements in y axis.
        max3 - Maximum number of elements in z axis.
        Returns:
        The plane, ordered as axis1, axis2 (oposite as getCubeData()).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the plane is invalid.

      • getCubeData

        public float[][] getCubeData(int plane,
                    int max1,
                    int max2,
                    int max3)
                      throws JPARSECException
        Returns the data in a given plane of the cube smoothing it if necessary. The internal variables are modified to properly account for the new size of the cube data.
        Parameters:
        plane - The index of the velocity plane in the file, starting from 0.
        max1 - Maximum number of elements in x axis.
        max2 - Maximum number of elements in y axis.
        max3 - Maximum number of elements in z axis.
        Returns:
        The plane, ordered as axis1, axis2 (oposite as getCubeData()).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the plane is invalid.

      • getRawCubeData

        public float[][][] getRawCubeData(int max1,
                         int max2,
                         int max3)
                           throws JPARSECException
        Returns the data in the cube smoothing if necessary. The internal variables are modified to properly account for the new size of the cube data.
        Parameters:
        max1 - Maximum number of elements in x axis.
        max2 - Maximum number of elements in y axis.
        max3 - Maximum number of elements in z axis.
        Returns:
        The cube of data as an array in 3d, ordered by number of levels (z), number of columns (DEC, y), and number of rows (RA, x).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getCubeData

        public float[][][] getCubeData(int max1,
                      int max2,
                      int max3)
                        throws JPARSECException
        Returns the data in the cube smoothing if necessary. The output is calculated considering that the blanking value is equal to zero, a requirement if the cube is going to be charted. The internal variables are modified to properly account for the new size of the cube data.
        Parameters:
        max1 - Maximum number of elements in x axis.
        max2 - Maximum number of elements in y axis.
        max3 - Maximum number of elements in z axis.
        Returns:
        The cube of data as an array in 3d, ordered by number of levels (z), number of columns (DEC, y), and number of rows (RA, x).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • updateWCS

        public void updateWCS()
               throws JPARSECException
        Updates the WCS in case the array conversionFormula has been modified by hand.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getWCS

        public WCS getWCS(int dim1,
         int dim2)
           throws JPARSECException
        Returns the WCS instance smoothed to a given resolution. This method uses the current WCS instance and cube data to do the transformation to use coordinates in a different datacube.
        Parameters:
        dim1 - Dimension in axis 1 (RA).
        dim2 - Dimension in axis 2 (DEC).
        Returns:
        The WCS instance.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • setCubeData

        public void setCubeData(float[][][] cube)
                 throws JPARSECException
        Sets the datacube to a given cube data, changing the WCS data, the extrema (minimum/maximum fluxes and their positions), the conversion formula, and the resolution in velocity and frequency accordingly. This method implies that the input file (if any) will not be read again. To read it again set the input cube to null.
        Parameters:
        cube - The cube data.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs, for example if the file is not an lmv one.

      • FlipCubeToGetPositiveIncrements

        public void FlipCubeToGetPositiveIncrements()
                                     throws JPARSECException
        Flips the cube to get positive x, y, and z increments. When this method is called from a cube read from file, the cube property is set to the cube data to avoid reading the file again later, so memory is consumed. If this is a problem it is better to avoid calling this method, since the VISAD and SGT graphic libraries re-scale automatically the data if a negative increment is found.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getPositionFromOffset

        public double[] getPositionFromOffset(double offsetRA,
                             double offsetDEC)
        Transforms a given offset respect to the central position in the map to its (x, y) position in the cube matrix.
        Parameters:
        offsetRA - Offset in RA relative to center, in radians (sky plain, not offset in coordinates).
        offsetDEC - Offset in DEC relative to center, in radians.
        Returns:
        Position (x, y) in the cube matrix. This position can be used directly with a WCS transform.

      • getOffsetFromPosition

        public double[] getOffsetFromPosition(double px,
                             double py)
        Transforms a given position in the cube matrix to coordinate offsets.
        Parameters:
        px - Position in the matrix in x axis (RA), from 0 to axis1Dim-1.
        py - Position in the matrix in y axis (DEC), from 0 to axis2Dim-1.
        Returns:
        Offsets in RA and DEC, radians.

      • resample

        public void resample(int w,
            int h,
            boolean rawData)
              throws JPARSECException
        Resamples the cube to a different resolution using a high-quality 2d spline interpolation method (function ImageSplineTransform.resize(int, int)). Note that 3d interpolation is not supported, so the velocity axis is not resampled. Each velocity plane is treated separately. Note also that errors could arise if no enough memory is available. After this is done, the cube can no longer be read again from a file, it will be stored in memory.
        Parameters:
        w - New width (axis 1 or RA).
        h - New height (axis 2 or DEC).
        rawData - True to process raw data, false to consider blanking = 0.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • resample

        public void resample(int w,
            int h,
            int l,
            boolean spline,
            boolean rawData)
              throws JPARSECException
        Resamples the cube to a different resolution using a high-quality 2d spline interpolation method (function ImageSplineTransform.resize(int, int)). Velocity axis is resampled using linear/spline interpolation. Note also that errors could arise if no enough memory is available. After this is done, the cube can no longer be read again from a file, it will be stored in memory.
        Parameters:
        w - New width (axis 1 or RA).
        h - New height (axis 2 or DEC).
        l - New resolution (axis 3 or VEL).
        spline - True to use spline interpolation, false for linear.
        rawData - True to process raw data, false to consider blanking = 0.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • integratedIntensity

        public float[][] integratedIntensity()
                              throws JPARSECException
        Returns the integrated intensity of the cube.
        Returns:
        The integrated intensity as a float[][] object, ordered as [i][j] (different from the ordering of the cube data!).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • integratedIntensity

        public float[][] integratedIntensity(double minIntensity)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Returns the integrated intensity of the cube.
        Parameters:
        minIntensity - The minimum intensity to consider a given channel and add its intensity to the output integrated intensity map. This value is like a 3 sigma threshold.
        Returns:
        The integrated intensity as a float[][] object, ordered as [i][j] (different from the ordering of the cube data!).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • integratedIntensity

        public float[][] integratedIntensity(int chan0,
                            int chanf)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Returns the integrated intensity of the cube between a given range of channels.
        Parameters:
        chan0 - First channel for the integrated intensity, from 0 to axis3Dim-1.
        chanf - Last channel for the integrated intensity, from 0 to axis3Dim-1.
        Returns:
        The integrated intensity as a float[][] object, ordered as [i][j] (different from the ordering of the cube data!).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs, for instance for an invalid range of channels.

      • integratedIntensity

        public float[][] integratedIntensity(int chan0,
                            int chanf,
                            double threeSigma)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Returns the integrated intensity of the cube between a given range of channels.
        Parameters:
        chan0 - First channel for the integrated intensity, from 0 to axis3Dim-1.
        chanf - Last channel for the integrated intensity, from 0 to axis3Dim-1.
        threeSigma - Value for 3 sigma threshold. All channels with intensity greater or equal to this value will be considered with adding flux to the integrated intensity.
        Returns:
        The integrated intensity as a float[][] object, ordered as [i][j] (different from the ordering of the cube data!).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs, for instance for an invalid range of channels.

      • integratedIntensityKeepOrdering

        public float[][] integratedIntensityKeepOrdering(int chan0,
                                        int chanf)
                                          throws JPARSECException
        Returns the integrated intensity of the cube.
        Parameters:
        chan0 - First channel index for the integrated intensity, from 0 to axis3Dim-1.
        chanf - Last channel index for the integrated intensity, from 0 to axis3Dim-1.
        Returns:
        The integrated intensity as a float[][] object, ordered as [j][i] (same from the ordering of the cube data!).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs, for instance for an invalid range of channels.

      • integratedIntensityKeepOrdering

        public float[][] integratedIntensityKeepOrdering(int chan0,
                                        int chanf,
                                        double threeSigma)
                                          throws JPARSECException
        Returns the integrated intensity of the cube.
        Parameters:
        chan0 - First channel index for the integrated intensity, from 0 to axis3Dim-1.
        chanf - Last channel index for the integrated intensity, from 0 to axis3Dim-1.
        threeSigma - Value for 3 sigma threshold. All channels with intensity greater or equal to this value will be considered with adding flux to the integrated intensity.
        Returns:
        The integrated intensity as a float[][] object, ordered as [j][i] (same from the ordering of the cube data!).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs, for instance for an invalid range of channels.

      • integratedIntensity

        public float[][] integratedIntensity(int maxX,
                            int maxY,
                            int maxZ)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Returns the integrated intensity of the cube smoothing if necessary.
        Parameters:
        maxX - Maximum dimension of axis 1.
        maxY - Maximum dimension of axis 2.
        maxZ - Maximum dimension of axis 3.
        Returns:
        The integrated intensity as a float[][] object, ordered as [i][j].
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • integratedIntensity

        public float[][] integratedIntensity(int maxX,
                            int maxY,
                            int maxZ,
                            double threeSigma)
                              throws JPARSECException
        Returns the integrated intensity of the cube smoothing if necessary.
        Parameters:
        maxX - Maximum dimension of axis 1.
        maxY - Maximum dimension of axis 2.
        maxZ - Maximum dimension of axis 3.
        threeSigma - Value for 3 sigma threshold. All channels with intensity greater or equal to this value will be considered with adding flux to the integrated intensity. This is applied after the smoothing in case maxX, maxY, or maxZ are lower than the current size of the cube.
        Returns:
        The integrated intensity as a float[][] object, ordered as [i][j].
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • scaleIntensity

        public static float[][][] scaleIntensity(float[][][] cube,
                         float blanking,
                         float scale)
        Scales the intensities in a given cube multiplying them by a given factor.
        Parameters:
        cube - The cube to be modified.
        blanking - Blanking value to be conserved. If the cube was obtained from the raw cube data, the value would be the blanking value of the lmv cube instance, if not, this value should be zero.
        scale - Value to multiply intensities greater than the blanking value.
        Returns:
        The new cube.

      • addCube

        public static float[][][] addCube(float[][][] cube1,
                  float[][][] cube2,
                  boolean fixNaN)
        Adds the data in a cube to another, cell by cell. Cubes should have the same size, but no check is done.
        Parameters:
        cube1 - The first cube.
        cube2 - The second cube.
        fixNaN - True to consider a NaN value as 0 in the input cubes, false to keep all NaNs. Even selecting true output cube could contain NaNs in case both input cubes contain NaN for a given channel/DEC/RA position.
        Returns:
        The new cube.

      • convolve

        public float[][][] convolve(int maxX,
                   int maxY,
                   int maxZ,
                   double beam_x,
                   double beam_y,
                   double beam_pa)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Convolves this cube of data supposing that there's no emission in the offset 0 0, or it is already considered. A Gaussian convolution kernel is used, and points outside the map are considered. All posible NaNs are removed.
        Parameters:
        maxX - Maximum dimension of axis 1.
        maxY - Maximum dimension of axis 2.
        maxZ - Maximum dimension of axis 3.
        beam_x - Beam major axis size in arcseconds.
        beam_y - Beam minor axis size in arcseconds.
        beam_pa - Beam position angle in degrees, same Gildas criteria.
        Returns:
        The new convolved cube. The data returned is not applied to the current cube, which is left unmodified.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • convolve

        public float[][][] convolve(double beam_x,
                   double beam_y,
                   double beam_pa)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Convolves this cube of data supposing that there's no emission in the offset 0 0, or it is already considered. A Gaussian convolution kernel is used, and points outside the map are considered. All posible NaNs are removed.
        Parameters:
        beam_x - Beam major axis size in arcseconds.
        beam_y - Beam minor axis size in arcseconds.
        beam_pa - Beam position angle in degrees, same Gildas criteria.
        Returns:
        The new convolved cube. The data returned is not applied to the current cube, which is left unmodified.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

        Spatial resolution in arcseconds.

        public float[][][] convolve(double[][] kernel)
                     throws JPARSECException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The new convolved cube. The data returned is not applied to the current cube, which is left unmodified.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • scaleIntensity

      • scaleIntensity

        public void scaleIntensity(java.lang.String formula)
                    throws JPARSECException
        Scales the intensities in a given cube by applying a given formula to them. After this is done, the cube can no longer be read again from a file, it will be stored in memory.
        Parameters:
        formula - An expression in Java language as a function of variable 'x', which is the intensity at any position in the cube.

        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • clip

        public void clip(int inix,
        int endx,
        int iniy,
        int endy,
        int iniz,
        int endz)
          throws JPARSECException
        Clips a given cube to get a region inside it. After clipped, the cube can no longer be read again from a file, it will be stored in memory.
        Parameters:
        inix - Initial x index. First is 0.
        endx - Ending x index.
        iniy - Initial y index.
        endy - Ending y index.
        iniz - Initial z index.
        endz - Ending z index.
        Throws:

      • getChart

        public CreateChart getChart(int xindex,
                   int yindex,
                   int width,
                   int height,
                   Spectrum30m.XUNIT xUnit)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns a chart with certain spectrum.
        Parameters:
        xindex - Index in RA, from 0 to axis1Dim-1.
        yindex - Index in DEC, from 0 to axis2Dim-1.
        width - Chart width in pixels.
        height - Chart height in pixels.
        xUnit - Unit for x axis. Note here the corrected velocity mode is not supported.
        Returns:
        The chart.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getSpectrum

        public Spectrum getSpectrum(int xindex,
                   int yindex)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns a spectrum for a given position.
        Parameters:
        xindex - Index in RA, from 0 to axis1Dim-1.
        yindex - Index in DEC, from 0 to axis2Dim-1.
        Returns:
        The spectrum.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs, for instance if the cube doesn't include valid information about reference frequency, velocity, or channel.

      • getSpectrum

        public Spectrum getSpectrum(int xindex,
                   int yindex,
                   boolean applyBlanking)
                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns a spectrum for a given position. Observing time is set to J2000 epoch. Note the backend is named to 30M, but should be named correctly for Doppler corrections (default is correct for 30M). One of these: 'BURE','PDBI','NOEMA','PICOVELETA','VELETA', 'ACA','ALMA','APEX','ATF','CARMA', 'CSO','EFFELSBERG','FCRAO','GBT','GI2T','HHT','IOTA','JCMT','KITTPEAK','KOSMA','LASILLA','MAUNAKEA', 'MEDICINA','NRO','NOBEYAMA','PARANAL','PTI','SEST','SMA','SMT','VLA','VLT','YEBES'
        Parameters:
        xindex - Index in RA, from 0 to axis1Dim-1.
        yindex - Index in DEC, from 0 to axis2Dim-1.
        applyBlanking - True to apply blanking when requesting cube data (slow).
        Returns:
        The spectrum.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs, for instance if the cube doesn't include valid information about reference frequency, velocity, or channel.

      • convolve

        public Spectrum convolve(double beam_x,
                double beam_y,
                double beam_pa,
                int index_x_obs,
                int index_y_obs)
                  throws JPARSECException
        Convolves the current map with a given beam profile and at a given position in the grid. A Gaussian convolution kernel is used, and points outside the map are considered. All posible NaNs are removed.

        Note that output spectrum will contain the rest frequency as reference frequency for the default reference channel and velocity, which are 1 and the starting velocity of the cube. This frequency could be incorrect. Note the backend is named to CONVOLVED, but should be named correctly for Doppler corrections. One of these: 'BURE','PDBI','NOEMA','PICOVELETA','VELETA', 'ACA','ALMA','APEX','ATF','CARMA', 'CSO','EFFELSBERG','FCRAO','GBT','GI2T','HHT','IOTA','JCMT','KITTPEAK','KOSMA','LASILLA','MAUNAKEA', 'MEDICINA','NRO','NOBEYAMA','PARANAL','PTI','SEST','SMA','SMT','VLA','VLT','YEBES'

        Parameters:
        beam_x - Beam major axis size in arcseconds.
        beam_y - Beam minor axis size in arcseconds.
        beam_pa - Beam position angle in degrees, same Gildas criteria.
        index_x_obs - The x offset where the convolution will be done. Between 0 and the size of the grid in x axis minus 1.
        index_y_obs - The y offset where the convolution will be done. Between 0 and the size of the grid in y axis minus 1.
        Returns:
        Convolved spectrum.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • convolveGetGaussianKernel

        public static double[][] convolveGetGaussianKernel(double beam_x,
                                   double beam_y,
                                   double beam_pa,
                                   double spatialResolution,
                                   double samplingFactor)
        Returns a Gaussian kernel for the convolution.
        Parameters:
        beam_x - Major axis of the beam in arcsec.
        beam_y - Minor axis of the beam in arcsec.
        beam_pa - Beam position angle in degrees.
        spatialResolution - Spatial resolution of the output kernel in arcseconds. Since cube and kernel coordinates are mapped by indexes, the resolution of the kernel must be the same of that of the cube to convolve.
        samplingFactor - The radius of the kernel relative to the beam size (HPBW). Recomended value is around 4 for an accurate convolution, and should never be below 0.5.
        Returns:
        The kernel. Values outside the sampled region are filled with 0.

      • convolveMap

        public static float[] convolveMap(float[][][] cube,
                  double[][] kernel,
                  int index_x_obs,
                  int index_y_obs,
                  float[] emissionZero,
                  float convolveOutsideMapValue,
                  boolean fixNaN)
                           throws JPARSECException
        Convolves a given cube with a given beam or kernel. NaN points are considered as points with inexistent data, so that they will not contribute to the output intensity or the normalization factor in the convolution process.
        Parameters:
        cube - The cube data to convolve, ordered as levels, DEC, RA.
        kernel - The kernel to use, for instance a Gaussian profile from convolveGetGaussianKernel(double, double, double, double, double).
        index_x_obs - The position index to apply the convolution in RA.
        index_y_obs - The position index to apply the convolution in DEC.
        emissionZero - In case there's information about the flux at offset 0 0 (where the cube array has usually no data in case the number of dimensions is even) for each channel, set it here, otherwise null.
        convolveOutsideMapValue - Value to consider as intensity in points outside the input map. Set as 0 or positive to consider points outside the map in the convolution process (with flux = input value), otherwise set a negative value to avoid convolving outside the map.
        fixNaN - Set to true to fix all possible NaN values so that the output convolution will contain no NaN. Set to false to conserve as NaN those points that are NaN in the input cube and are coincident with the convolution point.
        Returns:
        The convolved and normalized spectrum data for the input position and each channel.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • convolveMap

        public static double[] convolveMap(double[][][] cube,
                   double[][] kernel,
                   int index_x_obs,
                   int index_y_obs,
                   float[] emissionZero,
                   float convolveOutsideMapValue,
                   boolean fixNaN)
                            throws JPARSECException
        Convolves a given cube with a given beam or kernel. NaN points are considered as points with inexistent data, so that they will not contribute to the output intensity or the normalization factor in the convolution process.
        Parameters:
        cube - The cube data to convolve, ordered as levels, DEC, RA.
        kernel - The kernel to use, for instance a Gaussian profile from convolveGetGaussianKernel(double, double, double, double, double).
        index_x_obs - The position index to apply the convolution in RA.
        index_y_obs - The position index to apply the convolution in DEC.
        emissionZero - In case there's information about the flux at offset 0 0 (where the cube array has usually no data in case the number of dimensions is even) for each channel, set it here, otherwise null.
        convolveOutsideMapValue - Value to consider as intensity in points outside the input map. Set as 0 or positive to consider points outside the map in the convolution process (with flux = input value), otherwise set a negative value to avoid convolving outside the map.
        fixNaN - Set to true to fix all possible NaN values so that the output convolution will contain no NaN. Set to false to conserve as NaN those points that are NaN in the input cube and are coincident with the convolution point.
        Returns:
        The convolved and normalized spectrum data for the input position and each channel.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • correctForPrimaryBeam

        public void correctForPrimaryBeam(double pbeam,
                         double pradius)
                           throws JPARSECException
        Corrects the cube for primary beam.
        Parameters:
        pbeam - The primary beam to use in arcsec, or <= 0 to calculate it automatically for PdBI.
        pradius - The radius of the region to modify in arcsec, or <= 0 to apply the primary beam correction to the entire spatial region covered by the cube.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getChart

        public CreateGridChart getChart(int plane)
                         throws JPARSECException
        Returns a chart of a given plane or integrated intensity.
        Parameters:
        plane - Plane number (first is 0), or -1 for integrated intensity.
        Returns:
        The chart.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getStrip

        public Spectrum30m[] getStrip(LocationElement loc0,
                     LocationElement loc1)
                       throws JPARSECException
        Returns the spectra along a given strip of this cube between two equatorial positions. The strip is created by considering all grid points that lies in a straight line between the center of the pixel position corresponding to the beginning of the strip, and the center of the pixel for the ending of the strip. No interpolation or data transformation is done.
        Parameters:
        loc0 - Position where the strip begins.
        loc1 - Position where the strip ends.
        Returns:
        The set of spectra, or null if there are no pixels between initial and ending positions.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If any of the input positions is outside the image.

      • getStripLimits

        public void getStripLimits(LocationElement loc0,
                  LocationElement loc1,
                  boolean onlyReduce)
        Increases or reduces the extension of the input locations to match the size or limits of the cube data, so that a strip can be obtained. Input location objects are modified so that the strip conserves its direction.
        Parameters:
        loc0 - Starting position for the strip, to be corrected.
        loc1 - Final position for the strip, to be corrected.
        onlyReduce - True to modify the strip limits only in case any of the input limits lies outside the cube data, so a correction is strickly required to avoid an error when calling getStrip(LocationElement, LocationElement, double[], boolean, boolean, boolean).

      • getStrip

        public CreateGridChart getStrip(LocationElement loc0,
                       LocationElement loc1,
                       double[] contours,
                       boolean usePhysicalOffsets,
                       boolean offsetsRespectCenter,
                       boolean interpolate)
                         throws JPARSECException
        Creates a chart with a strip of this cube between two equatorial positions. The strip is created by considering all grid points that lies in a straight line between the center of the pixel position corresponding to the beginning of the strip, and the center of the pixel for the ending of the strip. No interpolation or data transformation is done.
        Parameters:
        loc0 - Position where the strip begins.
        loc1 - Position where the strip ends.
        contours - Optional contour levels for the output chart. Set to null for no contours.
        usePhysicalOffsets - True to show the offsets in the vertical axis in arcseconds instead of as grid offset, in both cases respect the center defined in the next input parameter.
        offsetsRespectCenter - True to return offsets range respect the center of the defined strip, false to return them respect the center of the cube.
        interpolate - True to interpolate in-between pixels, false to return the observed true data for each pixel, despite the strip will no pass exactly through the center of the pixels.
        Returns:
        The output chart, or null if there are no pixels between initial and ending positions.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If any of the input positions is outside the image.

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Test program.
        Parameters:
        args - Unused.
